links.title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Boeing, GE, Blackstone, First Solar & more
links.description: Boeing (BA) - Boeing lost $1.39 per share for the third quarter, smaller than the loss of $2.52 anticipated by Wall Street. Revenue was also above estimates. Boeing said it was targeting a workforce of 130,000 by the end of 2021, which is about 11,000 lower than the current total.

links.title: Akamai Stock Slides in Late Trading Despite Earnings Beat
links.description: Akamai Technologies posted better-than-expected third-quarter financial results, but the stock is trading lower after hours on Tuesday. The content-delivery network and security software company posted revenue for the quarter of $793 million, up 12% from a year ago, and ahead of the Street consensus at $775 million.

messages.body: $AKAM anybody think my 10/30 95p gonna payout tomorrow or thursday????

$AKAM 2021E revenue is 3.1B and with a 17b market cap = Forward P/S of 5.5. 

$FSLY 2021E revenue is 420M and with a 8b market cap = Forward P/S of 20. 

So Fastly is about 3.5x more expensive that Akamai while having a similar CDN network. If they don't execute perfectly, they will get dumped hard.

A forward P/S of 5.5 on Fastly is a 2.2b market cap or 60% lower from here. Hedge accordingly

$FSLY 10% main a/c - holding this low 70s level heading into tomorrows ER. Appears to have totally lost TikTok due to reasons outside its control - $AKAM has local offices etc. The additional info in the ER and the Conf Call will dictate a lot for me going forward
$AKAM did 800M revenue in 90 days and is valued at 17B. It beat earnings and still sold off... $FSLY is expected to do ~70M revenue in 90 days and is valued at 8B. Math Is not adding up for Fastly.
$AKAM that was not a bad call at all. Prior calls I did not like Leighton's wording. So a beat on top and bottom and right in the middle of consensus for Q4 & 2020. Should get some $130+ PTs tomorrow

$AKAM Akamai Stock Slides in Late Trading Despite Earnings Beat

links.title: Akamai Stock Slides in Late Trading Despite Earnings Beat
links.description: The content-delivery network and security software company posted revenue for the quarter of $793 million, up 12% from a year ago, and ahead of the Street consensus at $775 million. Non-GAAP profits were $1.31 a share, ahead of the Wall Street analyst consensus view of $1.23.
